bankid.heading: Compatible with Czech BankID (bankid.cz)
bankid.description: SignInspector fully supports verification of PDF documents signed with {bankid}, the trusted electronic identification system used by Czech banks and government institutions. Also compatible with EU qualified electronic signatures (eIDAS) and standard PAdES formats.
bankid.name: BankID.cz
faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.bankidCompatible.question: Is SignInspector compatible with BankID.cz?
faq.bankidCompatible.answer: Yes! SignInspector fully supports PDF signatures created with {bankid}. We validate the cryptographic signature, check document integrity, and verify the certificate against the EU Trusted List. BankID.cz uses qualified electronic signatures meeting EU eIDAS standards.
faq.privacy.question: Does my PDF leave my device?
faq.privacy.answer: {no} SignInspector runs entirely in your browser. Your PDF is processed locally using JavaScript and never uploaded to any server. This ensures complete privacy and makes it safe to validate sensitive documents like contracts, invoices, or legal papers.
faq.modified.question: What does "Document modified after signing" mean?
faq.modified.answer: This means the content of the PDF has changed since the digital signature was applied. The cryptographic hash no longer matches, indicating potential tampering or accidental modification. A valid signature on an unmodified document will show "VERIFIED" status.
faq.formats.question: What signature formats are supported?
faq.formats.answer: SignInspector supports standard PDF signatures including PAdES (PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures), CMS/PKCS#7 signatures, BankID.cz signatures, EU qualified signatures (eIDAS), and most common PDF signature formats. We validate against the EU Trusted List for qualified trust service providers.
faq.algorithms.question: Which algorithms and regions are supported?
faq.algorithms.answer: Currently supports RSA and ECDSA-based signatures for EU/US standards. Support for Chinese SM2/SM3 and Russian GOST signatures is planned but not yet available.
algorithms.limitation.title: Algorithm Support
algorithms.limitation.current: Currently supports RSA and ECDSA-based PDF signatures
algorithms.limitation.unsupported: Signature uses an algorithm not yet supported by SignInspector (e.g., SM2 or GOST). Cryptographic verification could not be performed.
algorithms.limitation.details: Algorithms such as SM2/SM3 (Chinese standard) and GOST (Russian standard) are not yet supported in this version.
glossary.pades: PAdES (PDF Advanced Electronic Signatures) - EU standard for long-term PDF signatures

glossary.euTrustList: EU Trusted List - Official registry of qualified trust service providers in the European Union
glossary.indeterminate: Indeterminate status means validation cannot be completed with available information
glossary.byteRange: ByteRange defines which parts of the PDF are covered by the signature
glossary.cms: CMS (Cryptographic Message Syntax) - Standard format for digitally signed data
glossary.qc: QC (Qualified Certificate) - Certificate issued by a qualified trust service provider
